service: AWS Signer Data Plane service provides APIs for checking revocation status of signed artifacts.

operations.GetRevocationStatus: Retrieves the revocation status for a signed artifact by checking if the signing profile, job, or certificate has been revoked.

AccessDeniedException.base: You do not have sufficient permissions to perform this action.

refs.GetRevocationStatusRequest$profileVersio: The ARN of the signing profile version used to sign the artifact.
refs.GetRevocationStatusRequest$jobArn: The ARN of the signing job that produced the signature.

refs.GetRevocationStatusRequest$certificateHa: List of certificate hashes to check for revocation.

GetRevocationStatusResponse.base: Response containing the list of revoked entities.

refs.GetRevocationStatusRequest$platformId: The platform identifier for the signing platform used.

refs.GetRevocationStatusResponse$revokedEntit: List of entity identifiers that have been revoked. Empty if no revocations found.

refs.GetRevocationStatusRequest$signatureTime: The timestamp when the artifact was signed, in ISO 8601 format.

TooManyRequestsException.base: The request was denied due to request throttling.

ValidationException.base: The request contains invalid parameters or is malformed.
